Herb Mashed Potatoes

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking to elevate your dinner table with a delicious side dish, look no further than our Herb Mashed Potatoes. This recipe combines the creamy richness of perfectly mashed potatoes with the fresh flavors of herbs, making it a delightful accompaniment to any meal. Using just a handful of ingredients, including buttery Yukon Gold potatoes, creamy milk, and vibrant parsley, these Herb Mashed Potatoes are not only easy to prepare but also packed with flavor. Whether you're serving them at a holiday gathering or a cozy family dinner, this mash will impress your guests and leave them asking for more. Read on to discover the step-by-step process for creating this delightful dish that will surely become a staple in your kitchen!

Ingredients

potatoes

Choose starchy potatoes like Russets or Yukon Golds for a fluffy texture. If you need a lower-carb option, consider using cauliflower. Ensure they are cut into uniform pieces for even cooking.

butter

Use unsalted butter for more control over the saltiness. For a richer flavor, try using European-style butter, which has a higher fat content. If you're looking for a dairy-free option, you can substitute with olive oil or vegan butter.

milk

Whole milk will give a creamier texture, but you can use low-fat or non-dairy milk (like almond or oat milk) if preferred. Warm the milk before adding it to the potatoes to help maintain their temperature and prevent them from becoming gummy.

fresh parsley

Chopped fresh parsley adds a bright flavor; you can substitute with other herbs like chives, dill, or thyme for different flavor profiles. If using dried herbs, reduce the amount by about a third as they are more concentrated.

salt

Start with a small amount and gradually increase, as the butter and any other ingredients may add saltiness. Kosher salt is a good choice for cooking as it dissolves easily and is less intense than table salt.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper has a more robust flavor than pre-ground. If you want to add some heat, consider using white pepper or even a pinch of cayenne for a different kick.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Potatoes

    Peel and chop the potatoes into evenly sized chunks. This ensures they cook evenly. Aim for about 1-2 inch pieces to make them tender quicker.

  • Step 2: Boil the Potatoes

    Place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with water, and add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boiling them in salted water enhances their flavor.

  • Step 3: Cook Until Tender

    Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender. To check, simply poke a potato with a fork; it should slide through easily.

  • Step 4: Drain and Return to Pot

    Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. This helps to remove excess moisture, making for fluffier mashed potatoes.

  • Step 5: Add Ingredients for Mashing

    Add butter, milk, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper to the pot. The butter should be at room temperature for easier mixing.

  • Step 6: Mash to Desired Consistency

    Mash the potatoes until smooth and creamy, adjusting milk to achieve your desired consistency. For creamier potatoes, add more milk gradually.

  • Step 7: Taste and Adjust Seasoning

    Taste the mashed potatoes and adjust the seasoning if needed. Additional salt, pepper, or parsley can enhance the flavor.

  • Step 8: Serve Warm

    Serve the herb mashed potatoes warm, garnished with extra parsley if desired. These pair well with a variety of main dishes!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I peel potatoes properly?

Use a vegetable peeler for a clean peel. Start at one end and move the peeler downwards, rotating the potato as you go. Make sure to remove any brown spots or eyes.

What does it mean to chop potatoes into evenly sized chunks?

Cut the potatoes into pieces that are similar in size (about 1-2 inch cubes). This ensures they cook evenly. For example, if one piece is much larger, it will take longer to cook than the smaller pieces.

How do I know when my potatoes are tender?

After boiling for 15-20 minutes, use a fork or knife to poke a potato. If it slides in easily with little resistance, the potatoes are tender and ready to drain.

What is the best way to mash potatoes?

Use a potato masher or a fork for a rustic texture, or a ricer for super smooth potatoes. Mash them gently to avoid making them gummy.

How can I adjust the consistency of my mashed potatoes?

If your mashed potatoes are too thick, add more milk a little at a time until you reach your desired creaminess. Stir gently to combine.

What if I don't have fresh parsley?

You can substitute with dried parsley; use about one tablespoon. Alternatively, try other herbs like chives or green onions for a different flavor.

How can I make sure my mashed potatoes are flavorful?

Taste your mashed potatoes before serving. Adjust the seasoning with more salt and pepper as needed. You can also add garlic or cheese for extra flavor.

Is it safe to handle hot potatoes?

Always use oven mitts or a kitchen towel to handle hot pots. Allow the potatoes to cool slightly before draining to avoid burns.

What is the best way to serve mashed potatoes?

Serve them warm in a large bowl. You can create a small well in the center for melted butter or gravy if desired.

How do I store leftover mashed potatoes?

Place any leftovers in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3-5 days. Reheat in the microwave or on the stove, adding a splash of milk to help restore creaminess.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a dairy-free version, substitute the butter with olive oil or a vegan butter alternative, and use almond milk or oat milk in place of regular milk. To make it lower in carbs, consider using cauliflower in place of half of the potatoes for a lighter mash. These adjustments make the dish suitable for vegan and lactose-intolerant diners, while still maintaining the herbaceous flavor profile.

Pairings

Herb Mashed Potatoes pair beautifully with roasted meats such as herb-crusted chicken, grilled steak, or baked salmon. For a vegetarian option, serve alongside a rich mushroom gravy or a savory lentil loaf. As for beverages, consider a full-bodied red wine like Cabernet Sauvignon or a crisp white wine like Chardonnay, depending on your protein choice. For a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling apple cider or a refreshing herbal iced tea would complement the flavors well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Herb Mashed Potatoes in a large, shallow bowl, topped with a pat of melting butter and an extra sprinkle of fresh parsley for visual appeal. For added texture and flavor, incorporate some roasted garlic or finely chopped chives into the mash. Consider using a decorative serving spoon and pairing the dish with a colorful side salad or roasted vegetables for a complete meal presentation. Keep the potatoes warm by covering them with a kitchen towel or using a warming dish if serving buffet style.

#

Herb Mashed Potatoes

30 min
$5
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Side Dish

Tags:

Side DishComfort FoodEasy

Description

Creamy and flavorful mashed potatoes with a hint of fresh herbs, perfect for any meal!

Ingredients

  • potatoes: 2 pounds
  • butter: 1/2 cup
  • milk: 1/2 cup
  • fresh parsley: 1/4 cup
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/22/2024
